Wow, thanks for posting this. That's freaking amazing.
It should be noted that '2000X' is probably a theoretical value. I can't imagine being able to actually see anything above 500 without immersion lenses.
As long as it goes beyond 50x, sign me up!

My girlfriend asked me for a microscope for christmas 2 years ago, she wanted to look at pond water and blood.

I paid a lot more than $5, she's never opened it.
Pretty cool I see a lot of uses for those cheap microscopes in schools, and between biology enthusiasts. Now, can we please have a folding telescope?
May be useful in interplanetary missions, easily stored, relatively lightweight, high magnification, etc, although an electron microscope would probably worth the weight.

I just showed this to my sister. She's a retired biology teacher and does part time volunteer work in Liberia.

She says she is going to try and look into this.

From a non-medical, non-help-the-world, non-caring-about-humanity standpoint... this thing is STILL amazing! It's a dirt cheap, durable microscope that projects things and fits into your pocket. Add in the rest of it and... Yeah, it's amazing.
